definition: to weep disconsolately/to cry on each other's shoulder

sentences.english: She is bewailing the loss of her beloved husband.
sentences.chinese: 她在爲失去心愛的丈夫而痛哭。

sentences.english: I had never seen a grown man break down and cry.
sentences.chinese: 我從未曾看到過一個這麼強壯的漢子痛哭失聲。

sentences.english: At GaoYiFei sitting on the ground, holding the head down and cry.
sentences.chinese: 高一飛一下子坐在地上，抱着頭痛哭失聲。

sentences.english: But that night she sat on the top of the stairs with her head on her crossed arms and cried.
sentences.chinese: 可是那個晚上，她坐在樓梯口上抱頭痛哭。

sentences.english: I knelt there, ripped up the poem, and threw the pieces of paper into the air, crying (really hard).
sentences.chinese: 我跪拜它，然後撕了它，把碎片灑向空中，大聲痛哭。

sentences.english: For the first hours without him, I cried. A lot.
sentences.chinese: 在沒有它的第一個小時，我痛哭流涕。

sentences.english: Two idiots did not have a lot of capacity for liquor crying at the row finally.
sentences.chinese: 沒有酒量的兩個傻瓜，最後在巷口抱頭痛哭。

sentences.english: A quarrel only, with two people cry on each other's shoulder ended a noon.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的一次吵架，以兩個人抱頭痛哭一中午而告終。

sentences.english: Here and there, it was screams, tears of distress and grief.
sentences.chinese: 到處是尖叫聲和痛哭流涕。

sentences.english: If we couldn't have the hairpin , how can we do not burst into tears?
sentences.chinese: 如果連這枚草簪都無法擁有，我們怎能不痛哭流涕呢？

sentences.english: On hearing that her dad died, she cried her eye out.
sentences.chinese: 一聽到她爸爸去世，她便痛哭流涕。

sentences.english: One day, I realize from experience to am choked with tears am what kind.
sentences.chinese: 某一天，我體悟到痛哭失聲是怎樣的。

sentences.english: The Miser, on his next visit, found the hole empty and began to tear his hair and to make loud lamentations.
sentences.chinese: 守財奴再來時，發現洞中的金塊沒有了，便捶胸痛哭。

sentences.english: They all said that the true facts, Cao Cao cried aphonia, orders funeral Jinshi.
sentences.chinese: 大家說了實情，曹操痛哭失聲，命令厚葬近侍。

sentences.english: They came to a house in which lived a man named Chen Cheng and his family. The whole family was crying.
sentences.chinese: 他們來到一戶叫陳澄的家中，見全家人正痛哭流涕。

sentences.english: Chien displayed no emotion when his sentencing was announced. His relatives cried outside the court house.
sentences.chinese: 阮文海聆判後面無表情，他的親戚則在庭外痛哭。

definition: to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to weep disconsolately/to cry on each other's shoulder
to bury one's head in one's hands and weep (idiom)
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to shed tears while recounting sth/speaking in a tearful voice
